content:
• Monday, July 9, 2012
  • SNH

    Senior Housing Properties Trust (NYSE:SNH): Declares $0.38/share quarterly dividend, in line...

    Senior Housing Properties Trust (NYSE:SNH): Declares $0.38/share quarterly dividend, in line with previous. Dividend yield 6.7%. For shareholders of record Jul 26; payable Aug 24; ex-div date Jul 24. Shares -2.9% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 6:03 PM
  • NPTN

    NeoPhotonics (NYSE:NPTN) +17.2% AH after stating it expects Q2 revenue to exceed a prior...

    NeoPhotonics (NYSE:NPTN) +17.2% AH after stating it expects Q2 revenue to exceed a prior guidance range of $55M-$61M (the consensus stands at $58M) thanks to strong demand for a variety of optical component products. The news is a welcome change of pace for an industry struggling to deal with soft telecom capex and price pressure. FNSR +1.1% in sympathy. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM
  • AMD

    AMD -5.7% AH after warning it expects Q2 revenue to fall 11% Q/Q, well below a guidance range of...

    AMD -5.7% AH after warning it expects Q2 revenue to fall 11% Q/Q, well below a guidance range of +/- 3%. AMD blames weaker-than-expected distributor sales in China and Europe, and the impact of poor consumer spending on sales to OEMs. Archrival Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) has already seen a raft of estimate cuts, and downbeat commentary about PC demand has been easy to find.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:41 PM | 3 Comments
  • MAKO

    Mako Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO) implodes after setting lower sales guidance for 2012. The company...

    Mako Surgical (NASDAQ:MAKO) implodes after setting lower sales guidance for 2012. The company says that after getting off to slow start for the year, it now expects to sell only 42-48 RIO systems during the year - instead of the 52-58 called for in prior guidance. Shares -33.7% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:36 PM | 6 Comments
  • INTC

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) is investing $4.1B in chip equipment maker ASML. Intel will buy a 10% stake...

    Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) is investing $4.1B in chip equipment maker ASML. Intel will buy a 10% stake in ASML for $2.1B, and promises to eventually buy another 5%. In addition, Intel is committing $1B to ASML's R&D programs for cutting-edge technologies such as 450mm wafers and EUV lithography. Such a huge investment in a chip equipment maker is rare for Intel, and indicates the company is bent on maintaining a manufacturing lead over Samsung and TSM. ASML +5.5% AH. INTC -0.9%.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • AA

    More on Alcoa (NYSE:AA): Revenue is essentially flat sequentially with a 4% decline in realized...

    More on Alcoa (NYSE:AA): Revenue is essentially flat sequentially with a 4% decline in realized aluminum prices, -10% Y/Y with an 18% annual decline in realized prices. The company maintains its view of a global aluminum supply deficit of 7% in 2012. Earnings "beat" analyst forecasts that have come in sharply over just the past week. Shares +0.2% AH.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:18 PM | 3 Comments
  • LOGI

    Logitech (LOGI +4.6%) spiked in the final 20 minutes of trading after announcing it will ask...

    Logitech (LOGI +4.6%) spiked in the final 20 minutes of trading after announcing it will ask shareholders to approve a one-time dividend with payout of up to CHF125.6M ($128.6M) at the company's Sep. 5 annual meeting. A payout at that level would result in a dividend of roughly $0.78/share, or 7.4% of Logtiech's current share price. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM
  • PSMT

    PriceSmart (NASDAQ:PSMT): FQ3 EPS of $0.52 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $506.8M (+17.5% Y/Y)...

    PriceSmart (NASDAQ:PSMT): FQ3 EPS of $0.52 misses by $0.08. Revenue of $506.8M (+17.5% Y/Y) misses by $4M. Shares -5.1% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:13 PM
  • CKSW

    ClickSoftware (CKSW -9.9%) closes near its 52-week low after warning it expects Q2 revenue of...

    ClickSoftware (CKSW -9.9%) closes near its 52-week low after warning it expects Q2 revenue of $22.5M, and EPS of $0.03, below a consensus of $24.9M and $0.09. The company doesn't provide any reasons for the shortfall, and instead talks up a major contract it just signed with a telecom service provider. Oppenheimer (Outperform) is lowering its PT to $11, but continues to call ClickSoftware "the best positioned player" in field-service optimization software space.

     
     
     
     
    | 4:04 PM
  • PCXCQ

    Patriot Coal (PCX) resumes trading following the report of a bankruptcy filing possibly coming...

    Patriot Coal (PCX) resumes trading following the report of a bankruptcy filing possibly coming today. Shares move to penny stock status, -72% to $0.63.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:45 PM | 5 Comments
  • ARCH

    Beaten up coal names get beaten up some more in wake of the reportedly imminent Patriot Coal...

    Beaten up coal names get beaten up some more in wake of the reportedly imminent Patriot Coal bankruptcy filing. Arch (ACI -8%), Peabody (BTU -5.4%), Alpha Natural Resources (ANR -8.5%) The coal ETF, KOL -4.2%. Isn't this the sort of thing that happens at bottoms?
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 14 Comments
  • PCXCQ

    Patriot Coal (PCX) may file for bankruptcy as early as today, reports Bloomberg. Shares are...

    Patriot Coal (PCX) may file for bankruptcy as early as today, reports Bloomberg. Shares are halted, -35%. The company has apparently lined up debtor-in-possession financing as a precursor to the move.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:37 PM | 10 Comments
  • SFD

    An outbreak of a bird flu in Mexico appears to be worse than expected with over 2.5M chickens...

    An outbreak of a bird flu in Mexico appears to be worse than expected with over 2.5M chickens now affected and another 1M birds already destroyed. Though the effect on U.S. companies (if any) is still getting debated, shares of chicken sellers are trading lower with a downgrade on sector names from BMO Capital Markets also affecting sentiment. Decliners: SFD -4.5%, HRL -1.8%, TSN -2.5%, PPC -8.3%, SAFM -2.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:24 PM | 4 Comments
  • PCXCQ

    Pessimism about coal prices, which have been pressured in recent weeks by slumping Chinese...

    Pessimism about coal prices, which have been pressured in recent weeks by slumping Chinese demand, is taking a toll on the shares of many producers. PCX -10.1%. JRCC -9.3%. ACI -4.2%. ANR -6.1%. BTU -2.3%. WLT -3.2%.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:31 PM | 12 Comments
  • RRD

    R.R Donnelly & Sons (RRD +4.2%) runs up a gain after landing early antitrust clearance for...

    R.R Donnelly & Sons (RRD +4.2%) runs up a gain after landing early antitrust clearance for its deal to acquire EDGAR Online.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:12 PM | 1 Comment
  • ENTR

    Entropic (ENTR +4.4%) rallies after Needham starts coverage with a Buy and $8 PT, predicting the...

    Entropic (ENTR +4.4%) rallies after Needham starts coverage with a Buy and $8 PT, predicting the developer of home networking chips can gain set-top box share thanks to its acquisition of Trident Microsystems' set-top chip assets. Entropic soared two weeks ago after preannouncing a strong Q2.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:29 PM
  • MGM

    Wells Fargo sends a chill out in the gaming sector with its early read that July gaming revenue...

    Wells Fargo sends a chill out in the gaming sector with its early read that July gaming revenue in Macau is trending low. Extrapolating out the first week of data shows growth of 0%-5%, below the consensus estimate of analysts of 7%. Decliners: MGM -3.6%, MPEL -4.0%, WYNN -1.1%, LVS -1.9%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:27 PM | 2 Comments
  • FB

    Facebook's (FB +3.1%) plan to create a job board in partnership with 3rd-party platforms isn't a...

    Facebook's (FB +3.1%) plan to create a job board in partnership with 3rd-party platforms isn't a threat to LinkedIn (LNKD -5.6%), argue JPMorgan and Topeka Capital. Both firms bring up the preference of users to maintain separate personal and professional social networking profiles, and JPMorgan notes BranchOut, one of Facebook's reported launch partners, has seen a major drop in traffic (per AppData) since April.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:13 PM | 8 Comments
  • SUNEQ

    MEMC (WFR +3.3%) bounces a little after it's reported the recent sale of a Bulgarian solar...

    MEMC (WFR +3.3%) bounces a little after it's reported the recent sale of a Bulgarian solar project by the company's SunEdison subsidiary closed for $220M. That could help the company, whose solar wafer ops have been burning cash, pay down a bit of its $2.1B+ debt load.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:37 PM | 1 Comment
  • LMNX

    Luminex (LMNX -15%) shares slide after the developer of biological testing technologies says it...

    Luminex (LMNX -15%) shares slide after the developer of biological testing technologies says it will acquire GenturaDx for $50M subject to working capital reconciliation and potential additional contingent consideration for achievement of future milestones and/or product revenue. LMNX anticipates the deal will add ~$6M in 2012 operating expenses.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:28 PM
  • CEDC

    Shares of Central European Distribution (NASDAQ:CEDC) come off their trading halt to rack up a...

    Shares of Central European Distribution (NASDAQ:CEDC) come off their trading halt to rack up a cool 28.6% gain off of news of a new distribution agreement in Russia. Extra funds kicked in by Russian Standard as part of the deal will allow the company to retire debt.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:11 PM
  • DLTR

    Morgan Stanley continues the downbeat vibe from the Street on Dollar Tree (DLTR -3.6%), with a...

    Morgan Stanley continues the downbeat vibe from the Street on Dollar Tree (DLTR -3.6%), with a research note out calling out valuation concerns as it downgrades shares to Underweight from Equal-Weight. The ongoing thesis on DLTR is that investors have it "priced to perfection" on the expectation that consumers will trade down for value on economic worries.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:04 PM
  • PAAS

    Pan American Silver (PAAS -5.2%) shares are slashed to Hold from Buy at Deutsche Bank, due to...

    Pan American Silver (PAAS -5.2%) shares are slashed to Hold from Buy at Deutsche Bank, due to uncertain growth prospects stemming from implementation of draft mining legislation submitted in Argentina's Chubut province that may render the miner's Navidad project uneconomical.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:56 AM
  • FB

    Facebook (FB +3.4%) starts the new week by outperforming yet again. Shares are up 25% over the...

    Facebook (FB +3.4%) starts the new week by outperforming yet again. Shares are up 25% over the last month, compared with a 3% gain for the NASDAQ. The rally follows a report that Facebook will launch a job board that will aggregate listings from BranchOut and other third-party platforms, and a WSJ column noting at least 160 mutual funds and ETFs bought Facebook shares in May - including, oddly enough, some dividend and value funds.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:51 AM | 2 Comments
  • NSU

    Nevsun (NSU +3.7%) announces higher-than-expected Q2 gold production of 87K oz., and reiterates...

    Nevsun (NSU +3.7%) announces higher-than-expected Q2 gold production of 87K oz., and reiterates its revised 2012 production guidance of 240K-260K oz. of gold. NSU says copper plant expansion in Eritrea continues to progress for start-up in mid-2013 and orders have been placed for equipment needed to export copper concentrate by mid-2013.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:44 AM
  • SWI

    Systems management software firm SolarWinds (SWI -7.8%) slumps on a downgrade to Market Perform...

    Systems management software firm SolarWinds (SWI -7.8%) slumps on a downgrade to Market Perform from FBR's Daniel Ives, who thinks shares are likely to be range-bound near-term following a healthy 2012 rally. Ives argues investors need to see more evidence of international success and cross-selling activity before bidding shares higher, though he adds SolarWinds is "still in the early innings of a growth cycle."
     
     
     
     
    | 11:38 AM
  • TSLA

    Shares of Tesla (TSLA +3.1%) shoot higher with traders divided on if a short squeeze is in play...

    Shares of Tesla (TSLA +3.1%) shoot higher with traders divided on if a short squeeze is in play or if wild - but lingering - rumors that Apple could be interesting in taking a stake in the automaker is bringing in buyers. Rocco Pendola brings in a dose of common sense to the banter, noting that the company doesn't need to accomplish that much in terms of financial targets to claim success in comparison to giants such as Ford and GM.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:34 AM | 4 Comments
  • CROX

    Shares of Crocs (CROX -5.1%) move lower with a note out from Piper Jaffray lowering estimates on...

    Shares of Crocs (CROX -5.1%) move lower with a note out from Piper Jaffray lowering estimates on the shoe seller's business in Europe.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:23 AM | 1 Comment
  • NAV

    Barrington Research comes out with a defense of Navistar (NAV -4.4%) on its view that takeover...

    Barrington Research comes out with a defense of Navistar (NAV -4.4%) on its view that takeover prospects will continue to prop up shares after the company's engine announcement last week came in slightly underwhelming. The bear camp still sees a vast problem for the company with future EPA approval uncertain.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:19 AM | 1 Comment
  • MCPIQ

    J.P. Morgan's Michael Gambardella cuts his price target on Molycorp (MCP -4.6%) to $19.50/share...

    J.P. Morgan's Michael Gambardella cuts his price target on Molycorp (MCP -4.6%) to $19.50/share from $23, questioning whether MCP overpaid for its $1.3B acquisition of Neo Material. The analyst sees strategic value to establishing a big base in China, but he thinks the takeover may turn out to be too expensive if the supply chain becomes oversupplied and prices keep falling.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:17 AM | 4 Comments
  • ARNA

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +4.3%) rallies with the help of a Sunday Bloomberg column discussing...

    Arena Pharmaceuticals (ARNA +4.3%) rallies with the help of a Sunday Bloomberg column discussing potential M&A interest in the drug developer, thanks to recent FDA approval of its Belviq weight-loss drug. Analysts speculate GlaxoSmithKline (currently divesting a diet pill line) or Japan's Eisai (the U.S. launch partner for Belviq) could make a bid. 25.3% of Arena's float was shorted as of June 15.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:56 AM | 6 Comments
  • V

    Visa (V -2.5%) and Mastercard (MA -3.5%) face an "unavoidable" slowing in the next 3-6 months,...

    Visa (V -2.5%) and Mastercard (MA -3.5%) face an "unavoidable" slowing in the next 3-6 months, says UBS' John Williams, downgrading both to Sell. He worries that both stocks sit near all-time highs even as they are exposed to clear weakening in global consumer spending.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:54 AM | 6 Comments
  • BPI

    The dismantling of shares of Bridgepoint Education (BPI -20.1%) over losing an accreditation for...

    The dismantling of shares of Bridgepoint Education (BPI -20.1%) over losing an accreditation for one of its institutions displays once again the tenuous relationship between education stocks and federal funding. Though politicians are mindful of alienating millions of voting students and parents in an election year, the purse strings keep getting pulled tighter on the industry through regulation and legislation. On watch: EDMC, LINC, ESI-OLD, DV, OTC:NAUH, APOL, BPI, CECO, STRA, COCO, APEI, LOPE.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:50 AM
  • XOM

    ExxonMobil (XOM -1.6%) says its Esso Angola unit has started oil production from the Kizomba...

    ExxonMobil (XOM -1.6%) says its Esso Angola unit has started oil production from the Kizomba Satellites project located offshore Angola. The initial phase of the project is expected to produce 100K bbl/day of oil and recover ~250M barrels from the Mavacola and Clochas fields.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:39 AM
  • APKT

    Acme Packet (APKT -4.9%) bleeds some more in the wake of Friday's Q2 warning, after Cowen adds...

    Acme Packet (APKT -4.9%) bleeds some more in the wake of Friday's Q2 warning, after Cowen adds its name to the list of firms downgrading the VoIP infrastructure vendor in response. Also, Jefferies, which downgraded Acme last month, is lowering its PT to $17, stating it's "inclined to remain on the sidelines" for now even though it's bullish on Acme long-term.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:34 AM
  • PXP

    Plains Exploration's (PXP +2.6%) Q2 update shows daily sales volumes averaged 98K boe/day, with...

    Plains Exploration's (PXP +2.6%) Q2 update shows daily sales volumes averaged 98K boe/day, with oil and liquids representing 61% of total volumes (oil 57%) and natural gas 39% of total volumes; daily oil sales volumes rose 17% Q/Q. PXP expects to record ~$220M in pre-tax gains in the quarter related to an accounting practice.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:28 AM
  • TROX

    Tronox (TROX -16.3%) shares sink on news from Australia's Iluka Resources that it cut its...

    Tronox (TROX -16.3%) shares sink on news from Australia's Iluka Resources that it cut its full-year sales guidance due to deteriorating global conditions impacting demand for materials such as zircon and rutile. Iluka lowered its 2012 zircon sales forecast to 200K-300K metric tons, down from a May estimate of 400K tons.
     
     
     
     
    | 10:14 AM
  • MNK

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR +10.1%) jumps after releasing June prescription data for its...

    Questcor Pharmaceuticals (QCOR +10.1%) jumps after releasing June prescription data for its Acthar gel. Paid Acthar prescriptions for treating nephrotic syndrome rose to 115-120 in June from 103 in May, prescriptions for treating multiple sclerosis rose to 400-410 from 365, and prescriptions for treating infantile spasms came in at 30-35, compared with 32 in May. It's added Questcor repurchased $156.1M worth of shares in Q2 at an average price of $41.85.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:02 AM
  • NSPH

    Roth Capital joins the Nanosphere (NSPH +5% to $3.35) bandwagon, upgrading the shares to Buy...

    Roth Capital joins the Nanosphere (NSPH +5% to $3.35) bandwagon, upgrading the shares to Buy from Neutral and setting a price target of $4.50. Roth's upgrade adds to one from Jefferies last week following FDA approval in June of Nanosphere's bloodstream infection test.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:55 AM
  • YOKU

    Youku.com (YOKU +2.5%) and merger partner Tudou (TUDO +1.9%) trade higher after JPMorgan starts...

    Youku.com (YOKU +2.5%) and merger partner Tudou (TUDO +1.9%) trade higher after JPMorgan starts coverage on Youku with an Overweight and $30 PT. The firm is bullish on a general shift in Chinese ad spending from TV to online video. It views upcoming ad rate hikes and inventory expansion, a favorable content amortization schedule, and the achieving of quarterly profitability in 2013 as positive catalysts.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:50 AM
  • BPI

    Shares of Bridgepoint Education (BPI -29.5%) sink after one of its main units is denied...

    Shares of Bridgepoint Education (BPI -29.5%) sink after one of its main units is denied accreditation by regulators. The company says that it will appeal the decision. A number of peers in the highly-sensitive sector are selling off in sympathy: ESI-OLD -1.2%, CECO -3.3%, EDMC -2.7%, COCO -2.3%, APOL -2.4%.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • ANTM

    Amerigroup (AGP) +38% and WellPoint (WLP) +3.8% following news of the the latter buying...

    Amerigroup (AGP) +38% and WellPoint (WLP) +3.8% following news of the the latter buying Amerigroup for $4.46B. The deal is a big bet on the expansion of Medicaid, and the combined firm will serve over 4.5M beneficiaries of state-sponsored healthcare plans. Other Medicaid insurers are also rising, including Wellcare (WCG +13.3%) and Centene (CNC +16.1%)
     
     
     
     
    | 9:45 AM
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM Radio (NASDAQ:SIRI) opens 3.2% higher on heavy volume after reporting new subscriber...

    Sirius XM Radio (NASDAQ:SIRI) opens 3.2% higher on heavy volume after reporting new subscriber totals and raising its revenue guidance for 2012. The improvement in the company's numbers is directly attributable to stronger U.S. auto sales, but a horde of SIRI perma-bears keep up the chant that the company's business model is seriously flawed.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:42 AM | 1 Comment
  • QLIK

    Qlik Technologies (QLIK +3.7%) warns it expects Q2 revenue of $84M-$86M and EPS of $0.01-$0.02,...

    Qlik Technologies (QLIK +3.7%) warns it expects Q2 revenue of $84M-$86M and EPS of $0.01-$0.02, below a consensus of $93.6M and $0.03. Qlik, which has heavy European exposure, blames the continent's weak demand and weaker currency for the shortfall. Shares of the business intelligence software vendors are nonetheless rallying, after having plunged to new 52-week lows on Friday due to Informatica's warning.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:37 AM
  • TPR

    Analysts with Atlantic Equities upgrade Coach (COH) to Overweight from Neutral, helping give...

    Analysts with Atlantic Equities upgrade Coach (COH) to Overweight from Neutral, helping give shares a 1.1% boost premarket. Overall, sentiment on the Street remains bullish on Coach despite some pestering worries about luxury spending in Europe and China.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:26 AM

  • Market preview: Stock futures fall along with EU shares ahead of a meeting of eurozone finmins,...

    Market preview: Stock futures fall along with EU shares ahead of a meeting of eurozone finmins, while Spanish 10-year bond yields top 7%. The S&P benchmark is -0.25%. Concerns about China add to investor nervousness, which could be exacerbated by Q2 earnings season, due to start later with Alcoa's (-1.2%) results. Amerigroup +38% on news it's being bought by WellPoint (+5.3%). Later: Employment Trends Index, Fed's Williams
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • UMC

    UMC, the world's #2 chip foundry, is down 4.6% after reporting June sales of $310.3M, up just...

    UMC, the world's #2 chip foundry, is down 4.6% after reporting June sales of $310.3M, up just 0.9% M/M and 1.1% Y/Y. After shooting higher in March and April, UMC has now posted two straight quarters of minimal sales growth, as the chip industry's recovery slows to a crawl. It was reported recently that top rival TSMC's customers have become cautious about placing Q4 orders due to uncertain demand.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:12 AM
  • FX

    Premarket gainers: FX +39%. AGP +38%. WCG +13%. CNC +13%. MOH +10%. NSPH +7%. AMPE +6%. WLP +5%....

    Premarket gainers: FX +39%. AGP +38%. WCG +13%. CNC +13%. MOH +10%. NSPH +7%. AMPE +6%. WLP +5%.
    Losers: BPI -28%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:11 AM
  • COG

    Cabot Oil & Gas (NYSE:COG) +2.3% premarket after the stock is upgraded to Buy with a...

    Cabot Oil & Gas (NYSE:COG) +2.3% premarket after the stock is upgraded to Buy with a new $55 price target (up from $41) by Goldman Sachs, which calls COG the lowest-cost U.S. dry gas shale producer and says a pullback in shares of domestic oil producing firms appears to be overdone. The firm also reaffirms Conviction List Buy ratings for EOG, PXD and NBL.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:56 AM

  • Down more than 1% for much of today's session, European shares poke into the green, led by...

    Down more than 1% for much of today's session, European shares poke into the green, led by Italy, +0.9% and Germany +0.1%. The euro also bounces, now +0.2% and buying $1.2310. S&P 500 futures remain -0.4%.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM
  • MSFT

    Shares of LinkedIn (LNKD) trade 3.8% lower premarket after reports of a Facebook plan to launch...

    Shares of LinkedIn (LNKD) trade 3.8% lower premarket after reports of a Facebook plan to launch a jobs board on its site crop up to provide a potential competitive overhang.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:41 AM | 1 Comment
  • TXT

    Textron (NYSE:TXT) +2.3% premarket on news of its selection by the U.S. Navy for the...

    Textron (NYSE:TXT) +2.3% premarket on news of its selection by the U.S. Navy for the Ship-to-Shore Connector program. The ~$213M fixed-priced, incentive-fee contract is for the detailed design and construction of an initial SSC test and training craft with work to be completed by 2017. The contract includes options for up to eight production craft worth a total potential value of $570M.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:24 AM
  • SIRI

    Sirius XM Radio (NASDAQ:SIRI) says it added 622,042 net subscribers in Q2, marking a 38%...

    Sirius XM Radio (NASDAQ:SIRI) says it added 622,042 net subscribers in Q2, marking a 38% increase from its tally last year. The company increases its full-year 2012 subscriber estimate to 1.6M and sets guidance for 2012 revenue a bit higher at $3.4B. Shares +4.7% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 7:12 AM | 1 Comment

  • Yields on 10-year Spanish bonds +11 bps to 7.07% and those of Italy +11 bps to 6.14% as...

    Yields on 10-year Spanish bonds +11 bps to 7.07% and those of Italy +11 bps to 6.14% as investors continue to display skepticism that the EU can solve this crisis. Today's finmin meeting will try to convince the market otherwise as participants attempt to hash out the details the Spanish bank rescue and EU wide banking supervision, and whether to cut Greece some slack.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 AM | 1 Comment

  • EU stocks open mixed after sharp falls on Friday and ahead of today's eurozone parley. "The...

    EU stocks open mixed after sharp falls on Friday and ahead of today's eurozone parley. "The outlook for the week seems negative given uncertainties regarding the EU finance ministers' meetings, FOMC minutes and Chinese GDP data (due Friday)," says Credit Agricole. EU Stoxx 50 +0.1%, London flat, Paris +0.2%, Frankfurt -0.1%, Madrid +0.6%, Milan +0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:38 AM | 1 Comment

  • Asian shares fall following more gloomy signs for the global economy, including the depressing...

    Asian shares fall following more gloomy signs for the global economy, including the depressing U.S. jobs data on Friday, a plunging Japanese current-account surplus and declining machinery orders, and warnings from China about downward pressures. Japan -1.4%, Hong Kong -1.7%, China, -2%, India -1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:59 AM
